definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: Fasting the day of 'Ashura' ( Muharram 10) is an expiation for the year preceding it.
sentences.chinese: 阿舒拉日齋戒一天可以贖去過去一年的罪過。

sentences.english: Charles Luckman Success is the one unpardonable sin against our fellows.
sentences.chinese: 成功對於我們的同伴來說，是不可原諒的罪過。

sentences.english: All iniquity is sin. And there is a sin unto death.
sentences.chinese: 任何的不義都是罪過，但也有不至於死的罪過。

sentences.english: All iniquity is sin. And there is a sin unto death.
sentences.chinese: 任何的不義都是罪過，但也有不至於死的罪過。

sentences.english: It is our sins, our transgressions against God’s Law, that defile us.
sentences.chinese: 是我們的罪過違反了上帝的法則，使我們受到玷污。

sentences.english: He wants you to think God sees you as dirty, filthy with sin.
sentences.chinese: 牠希望你以爲神因你的罪過，而看你爲污穢不堪。

sentences.english: Chapter IV, The Criminal Subjective of Unjustifiable Self-defense.
sentences.chinese: 第四章防衛過當的主觀罪過形式。

sentences.english: Their sins are washed away by Christ's atoning sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌爲世人贖罪作出的犧牲，洗去了他們的罪過。

sentences.english: How many are mine iniquities and sins?
sentences.chinese: 我的罪孽和罪過有多少呢。

sentences.english: But it says here that the blood of Jesus cleanses us from every sin.
sentences.chinese: 但這裏講到，耶穌的血能洗淨我們所有的罪過。

sentences.english: The guide disguised his guilty of mixing the liquor width a liter of liquid.
sentences.chinese: 遊把酒與一公升液體混合的罪過掩飾起來。

sentences.english: First, it means “to cancel a debt, to pardon or remit guilt.”
sentences.chinese: 首先，它表示“取消債務，原諒或免除罪過。”

sentences.english: I hope Your Majesty will forgive my wrongdoings and allow me to finish what I have to say.
sentences.chinese: 希望大王原諒我的罪過，讓我把話說完。

sentences.english: Forgiveness removes the debt, but not the guilt.
sentences.chinese: 寬仁之心可以趕走罪過，但是趕不走內疚。

sentences.english: A bad translation of a good book is a crime.
sentences.chinese: 一本好書翻得差勁，可就罪過了。

definition: to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
unworthy/to let down/I'm sorry/excuse me/pardon me/if you please/sorry? (please repeat)
